main event: An unidentified flying object was observed via ground radar in Claremont, California on July 4, 1957.
interesting points: The UFO was observed as a stationary object and did not move during the entire 15-minute observation period.
Two male civilians witnessed an unidentified flying object in the vicinity of Claremont, California on 16 August 1957.

A group of observers in parked cars on a freeway saw a bright object, resembling a star, which appeared to move and flash. It was claimed to be moving too slow to be an aircraft and did not have flashing lights.
The object described in the report had a bright (colored) light, oval shape, and was the size of a car headlight. It accelerated suddenly and disappeared from sight.
The UFO was estimated to be at an altitude of 15,000 feet or less and caused shadows of the observers and surrounding objects due to its brightness.
witnesses: radar operator, two male civilians, group of observers in parked cars on a freeway
